meanings.definition: A slit or notch made by a saw or cutting tool.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter carefully measured the wood before making the kerfs.
meanings.sent2: The saw blade created precise kerfs in the wooden plank.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel peeked through the kerfs in the fence.
meanings.sent4: Her smile revealed tiny kerfs of happiness in her cheeks.
meanings.sent5: The old tree trunk was covered in deep kerfs from years of growth rings.

meanings.definition: To cut a kerf or kerfs in (a piece of wood).
meanings.sent1: He kerfs the wood to prepare it for joining.
meanings.sent2: She carefully kerfs the edges of the wooden board for a snug fit.
meanings.sent3: The chef kerfs the vegetables with precision for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor kerfs the marble block to begin shaping the statue.
meanings.sent5: The gardener kerfs the soil to plant the seeds in neat rows.
